alert.note: Alert for Sherman; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 6:54PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wallace and southwestern Sherman Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 553 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported a strong thunderstorm producing a landspout tornado 8 miles north of Sharon Springs, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspout tornadoes. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported a landspout in northern Wallace County. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Wallace and southwestern Sherman Counties. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Landspout tornadoes can form with a developing thunderstorm before rain, hail, and even thunder is observed. Landspout tornadoes are not usually associated with a wall cloud and are often difficult to detect with weather radar. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for east central Colorado...and northwestern and west central Kansas.
